itSMF Norway 2012 Conference - Call for Papers
The itSMF Norway 2012 Conference is taking place on 14th & 15th March 2012 at the Clarion Hotel at Oslo Airport.
Would you like to be a speaker? - or do you know anyone who ought to give a presentation?
We want to hear from you if you would like to give a presentation at Scandinavia's largest IT Service Management conferenceOr if you know of anyone we ought to invite to give a talk.

We are looking for speakers who can share their knowledge and practical experience of IT Service Management and address issues such as how to get started, what strategies bring success, what mistakes have we learned the most from, etc. We are particularly on the lookout for good examples of users' practical experiences. Our participants would also like to hear some less than successful stories - especially if something can be learned from them.
As in previous years, the conference will include plenum presentations, parallel sessions and workshops aimed at:
• those of you just getting started with ITIL and IT Service Management
• those of you looking to learn from the practical experience of others
• those of you seeking a greater understanding, professional refreshers and inspiration
• top management and IT services managers
We are looking for presentations covering all aspects of ITIL and Service Management, and in particular:
• Practical experience in the application of ITIL, Service Management and Lean
• The environmental benefits of good processes (Green IT)
• Business strategy, the IT area and IT governance
• The relationship between development and day-­‐to-­‐day operations
The deadline for receiving submissions is 3rd October 2011
For further details please download the attached PDF or if you have any questions, please contact: Silje Endsjø (E-Mail: silje.endsjo@itsmf.no / tel. +47 22 36 48 94).

itSMF® International is a not-for-profit organisation and a prominent player in the on-going development and promotion of IT Service Management "best practice", ITIL standards and qualifications.
